column4: sosubuntuko what else does it say? thats just for information ,theres more errors above

used synaptics to install ati drivers... :-{ must have damaged kernel or something?
what do you mean "a nice name"
i think a different mount point would probably suffice. i don't think that's a label shown on the desktop. create a new directory in /media - eg /media/Pretty
write files to your new disk?
: start a shell and "ls -lad /media/hdc1" - enter results here
gah! i thought i'd lost my beer
what user are you logged in as
: you could do, or, you could change permissions- try "sudo chmod a+rwx /media/hdc1
i-m stuck with error on loading ubuntu .... cannot access tty job control turned off.... can anybody help???
chown would do it (chown <youruse> <filename>) but you don't want to do that here. change the permissions like i said before
do you understand what all the drwxrwxrwx stuff means?
HELP! i receive /bin/sh: can't access tty: job control turned off.... CANNOT load ubuntu anymore...

ok. if you changed owned, then the rwx in the user permission set would allow *you* to access the stuff - but group and everyone are still read-only. in this case you really want group and world to be able to write, hence permission change. and, yes, this will work fine after reboot.
sosubuntuko: there are errors listed above that. possibly something about cannot access root or something: for anyone to help you they'll need those errors
ok i reboot and try to be back!
